doc.source_uri: 2025-08-31/China Feihe Limited 8 shareholder return to compensate for disappointing earnings low visibility cutting 2H25 guidanceCh_2025-08-31

passages.text: 8% shareholder return to compensate for disappointing earnings, new visibility; cutting 2H25 guidance

Feihe's 1H25 sales/earnings were down \(9.4\% /46.7\%\) yoy, in line with its profit warning on 4 July. Positive takeaways from the management earnings call include: 1) channel destocking was finished in Aug and sales should pick up sequentially from Sep onwards; 2) 3ppt out of the 7.7ppt net margin erosion was due to bulk powder loss (an industry headwind for all dairy leaders) and IMF GP margin was relatively stable. On the flipside, management cut 2H25 sales guidance to down \(11\%\) yoy (from up c10% as of the date of the profit warning) and expects 2H25 earnings to decline 10- 40% yoy (JPMc - 20% yoy). Given the low visibility in 2H25, Feihe plans to compensate the market with fixed Rmb2bn+ dividends and a Rmb1bn buyback in 2025 (implying \(8\%\) shareholder return). With a low 2025 comp base and increased government birth subsidy, we expect Feihe's sales/earnings to grow a \(6\% /22\%\) CAGR over 2025- 27 and believe the trading 10x 2026 P/E discounts most downside risks. Remain OW with a new PT of HK\\$5.4 (from HK\\$6.0) on earnings cut.

Sales decline due to destocking and delay of new product launch. 1H25 sales declined \(9.4\%\) yoy to Rmb9.15bn (lost 1ppt market share), mainly due to supply cuts in 2Q25 to destock channel inventory (JPMc 2Q25 sales down 25- 30%, vs 1Q25's up LSD). Due to the competitive market in 1H25, Feihe saw declining market prices for its flagship product (Zhuo- Rui) and eroding profitability for its distributors/retailers. When destocking was largely done in Aug, Zhuo- Rui's channel inventory level declined to a 5- year low of 0.5 month (vs 1.5 months in Mar) and market price recovered by Rmb20 (c8- 10%). Feihe expects sales to pick up sequentially starting Sep but is likely to remain yoy decline, as it targets to maintain healthy channel inventory. A new super- premium product is likely to launch by end- 2025, delayed from 1H25, waiting for regulatory approval (slower than expectations).

Margin erosion on the back of discounts, subsidy and bulk powder loss. Feihe's 7.7ppt net margin erosion (to \(10.9\%\) ) was mainly due to: 1) GP margin down 6.3ppt, 2) SG&A/sales ratio up 0.8ppt, and 3) lower government grants. The GP margin erosion was mainly due to c3ppt IMF GP margin decline (to \(69.4\%\) ; likely on more discounts) and cRmb300mn loss (3% of sales) from sales of bulk powder, by our estimates. SG&A expenses declined \(7.6\%\) yoy (lower A&P expense offsetting higher subsidy costs) but the SG&A/sales ratio increased on sales deleveraging.

2025 guidance cut & shareholder return maintained. For 2025, Feihe targets: 1) Sales including VAT of Rmb21bn (implying Rmb18.6bn ex- 13% VAT, down 10% yoy, by JPMc), implying 2H25 sales to decline 11% yoy; 2) Net earnings to be in the range of Rmb2- 2.5bn, implying a 10- 40% yoy decline in 2H25. For 2026, it expects sales and market share to recover yoy. Feihe remains committed to: 1) Rmb2bn+ fixed dividends for 2025 (including Rmb1bn interim dividend), implying a c90% payout; and 2) Rmb1bn share buyback by the end of 2025.
Sources for: Style Exposure - J.P. Morgan Global Markets Strategy; all other tables are company data and J.P. Morgan estimates.
Price Target (Dec- 26): HK\\$5.40 Prior (Jun- 26): HK\\$6.00

We are OW on Feihe due mainly to its robust IMF business, strong cash flow and improved shareholder return \(5.5\% + / 2.7\%\) dividend yield/buyback in 2025E, which protects valuation downside). With a low 2025 comp base and increased government birth subsidy, we expect Feihe's sales/earnings to grow at \(6\% /22\%\) CAGR over 2025- 27 and believe the trading 10x 2026 P/E discounts most downside risks. In the longer term, we believe the successful development of category expansion and/or geographic expansion will serve as key catalysts for a re- rating.
We derive our DCF- based Dec- 26 PT of HK\$5.4 by assuming a \(10.7\%\) WACC and \(- 0.5\%\) terminal growth, implying a \(13.3\times 12.7\times 2026 / 27\) P/E.

Figure 1: China raw milk price trend
As of late-August, market raw milk price was down 6% to Rmb3.02/kg, hitting the lowest point since 2011.
Source: Ministry of Agriculture of China (data as of 29 Aug 2025).

We cut our 2025 earnings estimate by \(23\%\) , mainly due to 1) a \(10\%\) cut in sales forecast (channel destocking and delay in new product launch), 2) a 3.7ppt cut in GP margin assumption (loss from bulk powder sales, a result of low raw milk price), and 3) higher fair value loss from biological assets (at YuanShengTai Dairy). Post earnings revisions, we forecast sales/earnings to decline \(9.7\% /34.1\%\) yoy in 2025E, implying down \(10\% /20\%\) yoy in 2H25E.

We cut our 2026- 27 earnings estimate by \(10\%\) , mainly due to 1) \(6\%\) cut in sales forecast and 2) 1.4- 1.5ppt cut in GP margin assumptions. Post earnings revision, we forecast sales/earnings to grow \(6\% /22\%\) CAGRs over 2025- 27E.
Table 1: Summary of earnings revisions and key assumption changes
Source: Feihe annual report (2024), J.P. Morgan estimates
Table 2: Summary of P&L - Feihe
Source: Feihe financial reports (2021-1H25), J.P. Morgan estimates.

We roll over our price target date from Jun 2026 to Dec 2026, and cut our DCF- based PT to HK\\$5.4 (from HK\\$6.0), mainly due to \(10\%\) earnings cut in 2026- 27. Our new PT implies a \(13.3x / 12.7x\) 2026/27 P/E.

J.P. Morgan uses the following rating system: Overweight (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will outperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe); Neutral (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will perform in line with the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe); and Underweight (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will underperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe. NR is Not Rated. In this case, J.P. Morgan has removed the rating and, if applicable, the price target, for this stock because of either a lack of a sufficient fundamental basis or for legal, regulatory or policy reasons. The previous rating and, if applicable, the price target, no longer should be relied upon. An NR designation is not a recommendation or a rating. In Americas equity research, some stocks under coverage have a rating but no price target; in these cases, we expect the stock will outperform/perform in line/underperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe over the next six to 12 months. In our Asia (ex-Australia and ex-India) and U.K. small- and mid-cap Equity Research, each stock's expected total return is compared to the expected total return of a benchmark country market index, not to those Research Analysts' coverage universe. If it does not appear in the Important Disclosures section of this report, the certifying Research Analyst's coverage universe can be found on J.P.
